SEARCH
Module com.example.poo
Package com.example.poo.utils

Class ViewManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.poo.utils.ViewManager
public class ViewManager extends Object
The class that handle what is displayed on screen and a vast majority of the games logic

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewManager

      public ViewManager()
      Constructor for the ViewManager class. It sets up the game's graphical interface, loads the WaveData.txt file, and prepares the main menu scene.

  • Method Details

    • writingFiles

      public void writingFiles(String filePath, String score, boolean canAppend)
      Writes a score or text content to a file at the specified filePath.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file where the content will be written.
      score - The score or text content to be written to the file.
      canAppend - A boolean indicating whether the content should be appended to an existing file (true) or overwrite it (false).

    • readingIntValuesFromFiles

      public int readingIntValuesFromFiles(String filePath)
      Reads an integer value from a file located at the specified filePath.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file from which the integer value will be read.
      Returns:
      The integer value read from the file, or 0 if the file is empty or -1 if an error occurs during reading.

    • radingHighScoreOwnerFromFile

      public String radingHighScoreOwnerFromFile(String filePath)
      Reads a string value from a file located at the specified filePath.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file from which the string value will be read.
      Returns:
      The string value read from the file, or "NO HIGH SCORER" if the file is empty, or "ERROR READING VALUE FROM FILE" if an error occurs during reading.

    • setTextAttributs

      private void setTextAttributs(javafx.scene.text.Text txtNode, String textContent, double x, double y, javafx.scene.paint.Color color, String fontPath, double fontSize)
      Sets the attributes for a JavaFX Text node, such as text content, position, color, font, and font size.
      Parameters:
      txtNode - The Text node to which attributes will be applied.
      textContent - The content to be set for the Text node.
      x - The x-coordinate position of the Text node.
      y - The y-coordinate position of the Text node.
      color - The color to fill the Text node.
      fontPath - The file path of the font to be used for the Text node.
      fontSize - The size of the font for the Text node.

    • setImageViewAttributs

      private void setImageViewAttributs(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imgv, javafx.scene.image.Image img, double x, double y)
      Sets the attributes for a JavaFX ImageView, such as the image source, and position.
      Parameters:
      imgv - The ImageView to which attributes will be applied.
      img - The Image to set as the source for the ImageView.
      x - The x-coordinate position of the ImageView.
      y - The y-coordinate position of the ImageView.

    • setImageViewAttributs

      private void setImageViewAttributs(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imgv, javafx.scene.image.Image img, double x, double y, double width, double height)
      An overloading of setImageViewAttrivutes , adding to it width and height.
      Parameters:
      imgv - The ImageView to which attributes will be applied.
      img - The Image to set as the source for the ImageView.
      x - The x-coordinate position of the ImageView.
      y - The y-coordinate position of the ImageView.
      width - The width to set for the ImageView.
      height - The height to set for the ImageView.

    • extractFileName

      private String extractFileName(String fullPath)
      Extracts the file name from a given full path by locating the last occurrence of '/'.
      Parameters:
      fullPath - The full path from which the file name will be extracted.
      Returns:
      The extracted file name, or the original full path if no '/' is found.

    • addElementToFile

      public void addElementToFile(String filePath, String element)
      Adds an element to a file if the element is not already present in the file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file where the element will be added.
      element - The element to be added to the file.

    • updateScorePeriodically

      private void updateScorePeriodically()
      Updates the score displayed periodically using a JavaFX Timeline. For demonstration purposes, the score is updated every millisecond. In a real application, you might update the score based on user interactions or events.

    • updateMoney

      private void updateMoney()
      Updates the money value in a file.

    • mainGameScene

      public void mainGameScene()
      This is the mainGameScene, it is where the game takes place, the loop of the game is here and is updated constantly using the AnimationTimer

    • transaction

      private void transaction(javafx.scene.image.ImageView ship, javafx.scene.text.Text shipCost, javafx.scene.image.ImageView shipCoin)
      Handles the transactions that occur in the ship shop (buying ships and choosing the one to play with )
      Parameters:
      ship - The ImageView representing the ship in the graphical user interface.
      shipCost - The Text object displaying the cost or ownership status of the ship.
      shipCoin - The ImageView representing the coin associated with the ship.

    • highScore

      private void highScore()
      Used to manage the high score node Updates the high score , and the high score owner if the high score is beaten

    • shipStoreScene

      private void shipStoreScene()
      Represents the scene for managing ship selection and purchases within the game.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the execution, it is printed, helping identify any issues.

    • winMenu

      private void winMenu()
      Represents the game over menu displayed when the player win the game. Displays the money gained and the number of killed enemies
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the execution, it is printed, helping identify any issues.

    • deathMenu

      private void deathMenu()
      Represents the game over menu displayed when the player loses the game. Displays the money gained and the number of killed enemies
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the execution, it is printed, helping identify any issues.

    • mainMenu

      private void mainMenu()
      Represents the main menu of the game, allowing players to navigate to different sections.

    • displayOwnedMoney

      public void displayOwnedMoney()
      Displays the amount of money owned by the player along with a corresponding coin image.

    • loadingScene

      private void loadingScene()
      Creates and sets up a loading scene with visual elements, such as the company name and a loading image.

    • startGameScene

      public void startGameScene()
      Initializes and displays the start game scene, including loading visuals and user interaction elements.
